description.narrative:
Project impact Economy-wide: The Project's contribution to value addition and both direct and indirect employment will be estimated using IFC's sector multipliers. The Project is expected to create between 200 and 250 jobs.
Stakeholders (employee skills): The Project will support the continuous development of technical skills and the development of industry-relevant skills and adoption of superior production techniques, which will lead to an improvement of the human capital in these countries.
Environment: The Project includes several climate related components, including installation of solar panels on the Company's facility in Morocco as well as plastic recycling through Dolicen, its new subsidiary.
Market impact Competitiveness: The Project is expected to have meaningful impact in market-level dimension of competitiveness (i.e. through demonstration and replication effects, as other players are considering investing in the automotive sector in Morocco). It will also promote the competitiveness of other related manufacturing sectors (e.g. automotive) which use the Company's output as their intermediary products. The plastic recycling plant (Dolicen) is a commercial approach to manufacturing that can be replicated by other players in Morocco. Installing solar panels may also set a beneficial environmental precedent in the market.

The proposed investment consists of up to EUR37 million senior loan package to Uni Confort Maroc Dolidol SA (UCM, Dolidol or the Company), a leading manufacturer and distributor of polyurethane (PU) foam and bedding products. The Company was established in Morocco in 1972 by Berrada Sounni Family and expanded its geographical footprint in Cote dIvoire in 2014. Dolidol has a 45-years track record and is a trusted and quality provider of bedding products with internationally recognized accreditations (i.e., ISO 45001, ISO 9001, IATF 16949). As of December 31, 2020, Dolidol employs 1,000 people and has a logistic platform (17,000 sqm) and 150 trucks. It sells its products through a network of 1,100 distributors, 50 owned stores and 10 distribution facilities. Dolidols investment plans include (i) an acquisition in Nigeria, (ii) a greenfield plastic recycling capex in Morocco and (iii) installation of solar panels (1.25MW) on the Companys industrial facilities in Morocco (the Project).
